Questo opera attraverso il ritardo nella clearance del cortisolo in cui gli ormoni dello stress elevati persistono 24-72 ore compromettendo la funzione esecutiva, l'esaurimento delle risorse cognitive dalla risposta alla crisi creando una capacitÃ  mentale temporaneamente ridotta, e l'affaticamento da ipervigilanza causando un effetto di rimbalzo con attenzione temporaneamente compromessa e rilevamento delle minacce. description.impact: Le organizzazioni mostrano costantemente tassi di errore aumentati e lacune di sicurezza nelle 48-72 ore successive alla risoluzione della crisi. Gli attacchi secondari post-violazione mostrano un tasso di successo del 40% superiore quando lanciati durante le finestre di recupero. Le istituzioni finanziarie sperimentano aumenti di frodi secondarie dopo una difesa riuscita contro attacchi informatici iniziali. I sistemi sanitari subiscono violazioni di dati durante il recupero da incidenti ransomware che hanno contenuto con successo. green.label: Bassa VulnerabilitÃ  - Resiliente
green.description: Protocollo di recupero strutturato di 72+ ore con checkpoint di sicurezza definiti. Personale di sicurezza nuovo dedicato monitora durante i periodi di recupero. Nessun rilassamento dei controlli di sicurezza o dei processi di approvazione durante il recupero. Validazione di sicurezza esterna richiesta prima di dichiarare 'tutto chiaro'.

Rotazione limitata del personale o gestione della fatica durante il recupero. Timeline di recupero basata in parte sulla pressione aziendale piuttosto che sui criteri di sicurezza.

Eccezioni di sicurezza o controlli rilassati permessi durante il recupero. Dichiarazioni di recupero guidate principalmente da considerazioni aziendali/PR.

sections.title: VALUTAZIONE RAPIDA

items.title: Recovery Timeline Management
items.question: Come long does your organization typically wait before declaring 'all clear' after resolving a security incident or crisis?

options.label: Structured 72+ hour recovery phase with defined checkpoints
Informal recovery period of 24-48 hours
Immediate 'all clear' declaration upon technical resolution

items.evidence_required: Recovery timeline documentation from recent incidents

items.title: Security Monitoring During Recovery
items.question: What happens to your security monitoring and alert sensitivity during the 48-72 hours after resolving a major incident?

options.label: Maintained or increased monitoring with dedicated fresh personnel
Same team continues monitoring with normal sensitivity
Reduced monitoring as team focuses on recovery and documentation

items.evidence_required: Monitoring logs showing coverage during recovery periods

items.title: Decision-Making Authority Changes
items.question: Do approval processes, security exceptions, or emergency access procedures change during recovery periods?

options.label: All controls maintained with no relaxation during recovery
Some expedited approvals but documented and reviewed
Security controls relaxed to facilitate rapid recovery

items.title: Staff Rotation and Coverage
items.question: Come do you manage staff fatigue and coverage for security-critical roles during and immediately after incident response?

options.label: Fresh team assigned for recovery monitoring with mandatory rotation
Mixed approach with some rotation but gaps in coverage
Same incident response team continues through recovery period

items.title: Communication and Celebration
items.question: Come does your organization communicate successful incident resolution to stakeholders?

options.label: Communication delayed until security validation complete, no premature celebrations
Qualified communication acknowledging ongoing recovery monitoring
Immediate 'all clear' messaging and celebration of successful resolution

items.title: Recovery Phase Security Reviews
items.question: What security verification steps are required before fully returning to normal operations after an incident?

options.label: Comprehensive security validation at 24, 48, and 72 hour checkpoints
Basic security review before resuming normal operations
No formal validation - operations resume when technical issue resolved

items.evidence_required: Security validation checklists from recent recoveries

items.title: External Validation Requirement
items.question: Is external security consultant or partner validation required before declaring incidents fully resolved?

options.label: Required external validation for all critical incidents
External validation recommended but not mandatory
No external validation requirement

items.evidence_required: External validation reports from recent incidents

solutions.title: Structured Recovery Protocol
solutions.description: Implement mandatory 72-hour structured recovery phase with defined security checkpoints at 24, 48, and 72 hours post-incident
solutions.implementation: Create formal recovery phases with specific criteria at each checkpoint. Include security system validation, staff assessment, external verification before progression. Prohibit premature all clear declarations.
solutions.technical_controls: Recovery workflow automation, checkpoint validation tracking, escalation for premature declarations

solutions.title: Fresh Eyes Security Monitoring
solutions.description: Deploy dedicated security personnel not involved in initial incident response to monitor during recovery period
solutions.implementation: Rotate incident response teams after 48 hours, bring in fresh security analysts for recovery monitoring. Maintain or increase alert sensitivity during 72-hour recovery window.
solutions.technical_controls: Automated team rotation scheduling, fresh analyst assignment system, alert sensitivity maintenance

solutions.title: Recovery Period Access Controls
solutions.description: Prohibit security exceptions and maintain all normal approval processes during recovery periods
solutions.implementation: Automated controls prevent security relaxation during designated recovery periods. Additional approval authority required for any emergency access during 72 hours following incident resolution.
solutions.technical_controls: Recovery period flag in access systems, automated exception blocking, enhanced approval workflows

solutions.title: External Recovery Validation
solutions.description: Require external security consultant or partner organization to validate security status before declaring incidents fully resolved
solutions.implementation: Contract with external security partners for recovery validation. Require third-party security monitoring during recovery periods. Mandate external penetration testing or vulnerability scanning before all clear declaration.
solutions.technical_controls: External partner integration, validation tracking system, automated external notification

risk_scenarios.title: Post-Incident Secondary Attack
risk_scenarios.description: After successfully defending against DDoS attack, security teams reduce alert sensitivity and approve emergency access requests more quickly. Attackers exploit this 48-hour window to launch credential-stuffing attacks that succeed due to reduced monitoring.

risk_scenarios.title: Recovery Period Social Engineering
risk_scenarios.description: Following publicized ransomware defense, attackers pose as security consultants offering post-incident assessments. During organizational relief phase, executives approve vendor access leading to insider threat establishment.

risk_scenarios.title: Celebration Timing Attack
risk_scenarios.description: While organization celebrates successful breach containment, attackers launch targeted phishing against exhausted IT staff who are less vigilant during recovery period.

risk_scenarios.title: Infrastructure Recovery Exploitation
risk_scenarios.description: After restoring systems from ransomware containment, organization rushes to resume operations. During 72-hour recovery window, attackers exploit incomplete security hardening and relaxed change management.
